actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that gains from the sales of patents to unrelated persons should be treated in the same manner as ordinary income from sale or licensing of patents.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code, with respect to computing the limitation on the foreign tax credit for corporations, to exclude from the reckoning of capital gains any gain from the sale, exchange or other disposition of a patent, an invention, model, or design (whether or not patented), a copyright, a secret formula or process, or any other similar property right.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to provide that gains from the sales of patents to unrelated persons should be treated in the same manner as ordinary income from sale or licensing of patents.
